alert.note: Alert for Coastal Waldo; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 3:22PM EST until January 17 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY MIX EXPECTED SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY... .Precipitation will back in from the Gulf of Maine beginning Sunday night and linger through most of Monday. Temperatures will generally remain at or below freezing resulting in mixed precipitation, including snow, sleet, and freezing rain. While no single precipitation type appears like it will accumulate to significant levels, the combination of precipitation types will likely result in hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations up to three inches and ice accumulations around a tenth of an inch. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine. * WHEN...From 7 PM Sunday to Midnight EST Monday Night. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected Sunday night through Monday with air temperatures remaining below freezing. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
